byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Morehead, Ky., and Richard Fausset from Atlanta.
byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and RICHARD FAUSSET

abstract: Legal nonprofit Liberty Counsel is offering pro bono legal representation to officials who refuse to recognize right of same-sex couples to be married, like Kim Davis, clerk of courts for Rowan County, Ky.
lead_paragraph: Kim Davis, a county clerk, will be represented by Liberty Counsel, a nonprofit that has been aiding officials who refuse to recognize same-sex marriages.

headline.main: Kentucky Clerk Who Said ‘No’ to Gay Couples Won’t Be Alone in Court
headline.print_headline: Clerk Who Said ‘No’ Won’t Be Alone in Court

snippet: Kim Davis, a county clerk, will be represented by Liberty Counsel, a nonprofit that has been aiding officials who refuse to recognize same-sex marriages.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
